Albert, Prince.translation[0].definition: (1819–61) the husband of the British queen Victoria, born in Germany, and also known as the ‘Prince Consort’. He was very interested in art, music, science, and industry, and he planned and organized the Great Exhibition of 1851. Many buildings and other places in the UK are named after him, including the Albert Memorial, the Albert Hall, and the Victoria and Albert Museum, all in London.
